title: Feasts and Offerings
shortSummary: Numbers 29 details the specific offerings and holy convocations prescribed for the seventh month, including the Feast of Trumpets, the Day of Atonement, and the Feast of Tabernacles. This chapter emphasizes the importance of obedience to God's commands in worship and the significance of atonement and celebration in Israel's covenant relationship with the Lord.
timeline: c. 1445 BC - Wilderness period during the Exodus

keyCharacters.name: Moses
keyCharacters.description: The leader and prophet who receives and conveys God's commands to the Israelites, including the detailed instructions for the feasts and offerings.

keyCharacters.name: The Children of Israel
keyCharacters.description: God's covenant people who are instructed to observe these holy convocations and offerings as acts of worship and obedience.

definitions.definition: A sacred assembly or gathering of the people for worship, during which no servile work is to be done.
A sacrifice made to atone for unintentional sins, restoring the relationship between the people and God.
A sacrifice wholly consumed by fire, symbolizing complete dedication and atonement to God.
A pleasing aroma to the Lord, indicating that the offering is acceptable and well-received by God.
An expression referring to fasting, humbling oneself, and repentance, especially on the Day of Atonement.

outline.heading: Feast of Trumpets and Initial Offerings
outline.description: Instructions for the first day of the seventh month, including a holy convocation, trumpet blowing, and specific burnt and sin offerings to honor God and mark the beginning of the sacred month.

outline.heading: Day of Atonement Observance
outline.description: The tenth day of the seventh month is set apart as a solemn day of fasting and affliction of the soul, with prescribed offerings to make atonement for the people.

outline.heading: Feast of Tabernacles Offerings - Seven Days
outline.description: Detailed daily offerings for the seven-day Feast of Tabernacles beginning on the fifteenth day, emphasizing continual worship and thanksgiving through numerous sacrifices and offerings.

outline.heading: Eighth Day Solemn Assembly
outline.description: The final day of the feast includes a solemn assembly with no servile work and specific offerings, marking the conclusion of the festival period.

outline.heading: Summary and Obedience
outline.description: A reminder that all these offerings are to be performed according to God's commands, in addition to personal vows and freewill offerings, underscoring the importance of obedience.

application: Commit to observing God’s appointed times and worship practices as acts of obedience and reverence.
Approach God with humility and repentance, recognizing the need for atonement and cleansing from sin.
Offer your life as a 'sweet savour' to the Lord through wholehearted dedication and service.
Participate regularly in corporate worship and solemn assemblies to strengthen your faith community.

keyVerses.text: And in the seventh month, on the first day of the month, ye shall have an holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work: it is a day of blowing the trumpets unto you.
keyVerses.significance: This verse establishes the sacredness of the Feast of Trumpets and the importance of holy convocations in Israel’s worship calendar.

keyVerses.text: And ye shall have on the tenth day of this seventh month an holy convocation; and ye shall afflict your souls: ye shall not do any work therein:
keyVerses.significance: It highlights the solemn nature of the Day of Atonement, calling for fasting and self-denial as part of repentance.

keyVerses.text: And on the fifteenth day of the seventh month ye shall have an holy convocation; ye shall do no servile work, and ye shall keep a feast unto the LORD seven days:
keyVerses.significance: This verse introduces the Feast of Tabernacles, a time of joyful celebration and remembrance of God’s provision.

keyVerses.text: And Moses told the children of Israel according to all that the LORD commanded Moses.
keyVerses.significance: This verse underscores the importance of faithful transmission and obedience to God’s revealed commands.
